intro: Fedorovia glaberrima, commonly known as the smoothleaf fedorovia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often smooth and glossy. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Fedorovia glaberrima is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and modest floral display.
